data.event: Kendal today is known largely as a centre for tourism, as the home of Kendal mint cake, and as a producer of pipe tobacco and tobacco snuff.
For many centuries it was called Kirkbie Kendal, meaning "village with a church in the valley of the River Kent".
The earliest castle was a Norman motte and bailey (now located on the west side of the town) when the settlement went under the name of Kirkbie Strickland.
